basics.name: Alex Sterling
basics.label: Developer
basics.summary: Alex enjoys designing and developing high-performance full-featured web applications with an emphasis on following web standards to ensure high quality.  He has experience spanning the entire web stack and learning new languages, frameworks or technologies to get the job done perfectly.  Extensive knowledge of building PHP, Java and NodeJS backend data services to support applications comes paired with frontend JavaScript/HTML/CSS mastery.  With 7 years of experience building web applications and skills in PHP, Java, NodeJS, JavaScript, DotCMS, SQL, CSS, HTML5, Dev-Ops, Testing and more Alex can deliver powerful web solutions that are maintainable.

work.summary: Developing for an array of clients, codebases and programming paradigms, working for Ethode has been a huge influence to increase Alex's depth in programming skills along with project architecture, dev-ops and systems administration.  The diverse needs of the clients taken on by Ethode taught important lessons in agile development, mixed-presence collaboration, business rule translation, expectation management and more.  Expertise in JavaScript (including AngularJS and especially VueJS frameworks), CSS (including preprocessors like LESS and SASS/SCSS as well as Bootstrap 3/4), Java (including Spring framework), Apache Webserver, Jenkins and more was developed over the past 2+ years.
highlights: Vastly deeper experience and mastery with the Java CMS: DotCMS
Java Application and Plugin development
Integrating third party APIs
Utilizing open source libraries extensively
Mastery of the VueJS (and Vuex) JavaScript framework
Experience with task runners and build tools such as Gulp, Browserify and Webpack
Developed and maintained backend applications running on Java, PHP, and Node
Developed and maintained frontend applications using Vanilla JS, VueJS, AngularJS, jQuery and LESS/SASS/SCSS
Led sessions discussing and teaching emergent topics in web dev such as VueJS, SASS/SCSS, Laravel, JavaScript, FlexBox, SSL Certificates and more
Automated deployment of web applications and webservices using Jenkins
Automated testing of web applications using various acceptance testing frameworks (primarily NodeJS based)
Deep familiarity with *nix server management including Centos, Debian, RHEL, Amazon Linux and others
Emphasis on frequent customer contact and collaboration with product owners
Large team Git repository managmeent
Mixed-Presence Agnostic

work.company: Digital Media Center, Johns Hopkins University
work.summary: The Digital Media Center is an advanced and specialized computer lab and equipment rental/borrowing facility.  The software on the computers ranges from 3D modeling/animation to Photoshop to ProTools.  The equipment facilitated the capture of media to be processed in the Digital Media Center.  A front desk worker would coach the patrons requesting assistance to the best of their ability as well as loaning equipment to patrons and training patrons on their use.
highlights: Trained and coached college students on a variety of digital media software and projects.  Software included Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe Final Cut, Avid Suite, Microsoft Office, 3DS Max, and Maya 3D
Opened and closed a 20+ station computer lab also specializing in the loaning out of audio-visual capture equipment and training on audio-visual equipment

publications.name: University of Akron Campus Map

Allows reader submission of articles, custom front-end formatting, and fine-grained permissioning.  The application can scale to an arbitrary number of publications natively.

references.name: Brad Rice - Web Graphics Designer at The University of Akron
references.reference: Alex is a rare find. He has the ability to quickly prototype applications, then build them out. He has exceptional skills in a number of programming languages, php being his strong suit. But he can use what he knows as a MVC programmer and use it with a variety of languages and frameworks. He also knows front end development with javascript and css.   I would highly recommend Alex to anyone considering employing him. Not only are his skill levels extremely good, he is a great person to work with.
